alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 04 at 8:37AM MDT until May 11 at 11:37AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Shoshone and Kootenai Counties. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. For the Coeur d`Alene River...including Cataldo...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Water will be up to Aqua Avenue in St Maries near Leeve hill and walking trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM PDT Thursday the stage was 31.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early tomorrow afternoon. The river is forecast to crest Saturday and begin to slowly recede next week. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun St Joe River St Maries 32.5 31.6 Thu 6 am PDT 32.0 33.9 34.6 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM PDT.
